|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 0.5 |ram1chip = GLT;GLT44016-35J4; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = b

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Gemtek WL-216C |rad1modif = <!-- Radio Module Interface Type, Leave blank for none --> |rad1chip1 = Harris;HFA3841; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;; |rad1chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = MMCX |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "34-WIP311-A0" is silkscreened on the board.
This device has a 10/100 Switch but only 10Mbit WAN and LAN uplink (provided by the on-board RTL8019ASes). There is no FCC ID printed on the label on the bottom of the unit.
To reset the device to factory defaults, hold the reset button while powering on the device. Release the reset button once M1 and M2 start blinking.
==Links of Interest== [http://www.practicallynetworked.com/review.asp?pid=388 Review on Practically Networked] :[http://www.practicallynetworked.com/item.asp?pid=388 Router spec table]
